concept.title: Configuring Your Own Containers
concept.shortdesc: You can configure your own versions of the DFST containers through custom docker-compose.yml files.

conbody.p: Full version of this topic TBD.

Short version:
If you haven't already, create your own project to manage your custom container definitions and docker-compose files.
Copy the dfst-docker/containers directories into your project.
Copy the directories under containers/ for the containers you want to extend into your own project's containers/ directory.
Rename the directories under containers/ appropriately.
Edit the Dockerfile files for the containers to reflect your changes and extensions.
Edit the docker-compose.yml files as needed to reflect your container details.
Edit the docker-compose/dfst-build and docker-compose/dfst-server docker-compose.yml files to reflect the locations of the docker-compose.yml files for each of your containers.
